title: Costco’s ‘Revolutionary’ New Fruity Drink Has Shoppers Pleasantly Surprised: ‘Better Than I Expected’
description: It's getting mixed reviews from shoppers.
content:
Costco’s ‘Revolutionary’ New Fruity Drink Has Shoppers Pleasantly Surprised: ‘Better Than I Expected’ originally appeared on Parade.

Parade aims to feature only the best products and services. If you buy something via one of our links, we may earn a commission.

If you’ve ever avoided protein shakes because of their thick, chalky texture, Costco might have just found the solution. A new fizzy drink from Genius Gourmet is turning heads not only because it delivers 30 grams of protein per can, but because it looks and feels more like sparkling water than a traditional shake.

The Sparkling Clear Protein Drink, which recently rolled out to Costco locations nationwide, is already going viral among shoppers who are surprised by how smooth and refreshing it tastes. At $28.99 for a 15-pack of 12-ounce cans, it’s shaping up to be one of the most buzzed-about beverage launches of the season.

🍳 SIGN UP to get delicious recipes, handy kitchen hacks & fun food news in our daily Pop Kitchen newsletter 🍳

Instead of the heavy, milky consistency that protein shakes are known for, this drink is completely translucent and lightly carbonated. That’s thanks to Genius Gourmet’s use of ultra-filtered whey protein isolate, which allows the beverage to stay clear while still packing in a full 30 grams of protein. It’s also lactose-free, sugar-free and just 130 calories per can, making it an easy option for post-workout recovery or a mid-afternoon pick-me-up.

User @costcobuys spotted it in the store:

Right now, the drink comes in a single flavor, blue raspberry lemonade, but shoppers say it’s surprisingly easy to sip. Many compare it to flavored sparkling water with a touch of sweetness, which comes from sucralose. The formula also includes natural flavors and mushroom extract as a preservative.

For those who’ve been searching for a high-protein option without the thick texture, this launch is a game changer. Whether you’re training for a race, looking to boost your daily protein intake or simply want a more refreshing way to stay fueled, this drink delivers without feeling heavy.

Costco fans on social media have been quick to share their first impressions. One commenter wrote, "We got them today and actually loved them! I have no idea how they have 30 grams of protein in them." Another said, "Better than I expected—tastes like a soda, but without the guilt.’

Others aren't so sure about the flavor, calling it "too sweet." I guess I'll have to buy some to find out for myself is this really is too good to be true!

The drink’s light, bubbly texture seems to be the main draw, with many people admitting they usually skip protein shakes altogether. Now, they say they’ve finally found something they’ll look forward to drinking every day.

Protein drinks have long been a staple for athletes and busy professionals, but this launch proves there’s still room for innovation. By swapping the creamy shake for a fizzy, fruity beverage, Genius Gourmet has created something that feels fresh and approachable—even for people who never thought they’d enjoy a protein drink.

If you’ve been on the fence about adding more protein to your diet, this might be the easiest (and tastiest) way to start.

summary: Costco's 'Revolutionary' New Fruity Drink, a fizzy drink from Genius Gourmet, has been popular among shoppers due to its smooth and refreshing taste. The Sparkling Clear Protein Drink, which delivers 30 grams of protein per can, is being hailed as a game changer for those seeking a high-protein option without the thick texture. It comes in a single flavor, blue raspberry lemonade, and is also lactose-free, sugar-free and just 130 calories per can. The drink's light, bubbly texture is the main draw, with many users comparing it to flavored sparkling water with a touch of sweetness.
shortSummary: Costco’s new “Revolutionary" Protein Drink, featuring a smooth, sugary texture and 30 grams of protein, is gaining traction online and is easy to sip.
argos_summary: Costco has introduced a new fizzy drink from Genius Gourmet, the Sparkling Clear Protein Drink, which contains 30 grams of protein per can while resembling sparkling water rather than traditional protein shakes. Priced at $28.99 for a 15-pack, it is lactose-free, sugar-free, and only 130 calories, making it a refreshing option for post-workout recovery. Shoppers have praised its smooth, light texture and flavor, although some find it a bit too sweet, marking it as a potential game changer for those seeking a high-protein beverage.
